content.detailedDescription: It was 5:15pm new years eve, tampa in seminole heights. i let our dogs out & i sat on our back deck looking at the trees & sky facing the east. a bright white dot appeared suddenly appeared to the east about seventy degrees from horizon line. i watched it for about 30 secs & it didn't move at all. i quickly grabbed the binoculars from right inside the door, always looking up:). i looked back to the same spot & didn't see it any longer. i looked through the binoculars & found it, i focused & another 30 secs or so  passed then another appeared. another two minutes passed, my arms stared to tingle, the second one just disappeared as it had appeared. the first one still hadn't move any further away & in the same spot. i looked away couldn't see anything with my naked eye, i then found the original again through binoculars & watched for another minute or so & it seemed to start to slowy get smaller. it lasted for about 5or 6 minutes total.  both of the objects were round & seemed to pulse with a bright fire like yellowish glowingness. i only felt happy & thankful to see these orbs...I waved, said hi and wished they'd come on down.
content.summary: Glowing orbs to the east in tampa

content.detailedDescription:
Coming back home, saw object stationary hovering , v shaped, orange lights.
parked car in garage, went back out and object  was gone ( less than one minute inbetween )
was seen by at least 6 others .
content.summary: V shaped object, orange lights, hovering stationary

content.detailedDescription: We observed a (what looked like) a pulsating fire ball moving in a straight path above our heads with no sound. we had gotten done watching numerous fireworks in the area and celebrating the new year when we observed what looked like a circular ball pulsating with flames in the near distance. it continued on a straight path above our heads and then headed off southeast until it was too small to see. there was no trail or other light emanating from the ball. in my opinion the apparent size with my eyes was about basketball sized. i fell like if there was an airplane the same distance it may have looked like the same size if not a bit smaller but i can not be sure as im not completely sure of how high it was in the air although i believe it to be less then 500 feet. i was also standing outside with 5 other people who all experienced the same object in the sky. we all agreed that it did not look anything like a lantern airplane or any kind of flare or firework. it was a very strange experience and completely unexplainable to us.
content.summary: We observed a (what looked like) a firey pulsating ball moving in a straight path above our heads with no sound. 6 other people observed it and we all agree it was not a flare firework plane or lantern. very unusual.

content.detailedDescription: We had 5 persons outside watching 2 red-orange orbs fly from the north(tampa direction) to the south to us(sarasota). they both flew a straight path 90% of the way seen, then 1 turned eastward toward us. the 1 that flew straight shortly after the other turned climbed in altitude very fast and disappeared in about 3-5 seconds. the orb that turned flew toward us for about 10 seconds stopped and hovered for about 10-15 seconds and then it also climbed in altitude very fast and disappeared in about 5 seconds.
content.flightPath: Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: 2 orange-red orbs flew from north to south, 1 climbed altitude very fast and disappeared, 1 hovered for 15 seconds then climbed altitude fast away.

content.detailedDescription:
I was sitting inside watching new years eve special on tv, my daughter
had been on the porch cleaning her bunny cage, then came back in, as
she did a orange light caught my eye i said 'what the heck is that'
and bent over to look closer...Still couldn't figure it out so
mentioned to my kids about it, only one got up with me as they were
focused on the tv music performance, but she and i went to the porch
and saw the orange star-like through the trees.
we both were amazed, and trying to figure out what they could be. we
noticed venus on the other side of the sky and noted it was smaller
and dimmer than the orange light on the other side of the house, near
the lower left side stars of orion. we decided it was not a star as it
was rising very slowly, too slowly to be a plane or fireworks. so
slowly i likely would not have even noticed it was moving had it not
been orange and so bright.
then suddenly at about 25 degrees above the horizon it disappeared,
there was no flash or explosion like fireworks would have made and
again it had been rising too slowly for 3 or 4 minutes (from just 5 or
10 degrees above the horizon when i first saw it) before disappearing.
we watched for about 30 seconds to one minute, then it reappeared in
the same spot, with another one exactly like it slightly higher and to
its left. then they both started rising again very slowly...Steadily.
after 2 or 3 more minutes. i had time to run inside and get my camera
to take 2 photos, my daughter tried to take 2 on her iphone too both lights disappeared again without any flash, sound, or explosion. at about 45 degrees above the horizon for the first one and maybe 50 degrees up for the 2nd higher one, they just winked out. they seemed very far off from us, but we heard no sounds.
we both watched for several minutes but they did not reappear, and we
checked for the next hour or so but never saw the lights again. our
pictures were so dark, nothing could be seen. after lightening and
turning the contrast all the way up on the computer the photos would
show the outline of the trees in the foreground but not the lights.
i am an artist, and painted what we saw the next morning, as the photos didn't turn out. the painting shows the final moments when both lights were seen at the highest point nearing orion's stars. the first one had risen from the horizon of mountains off in the distance to a mid point,through the trees in the foreground... then winked out then came back with the second one before both started rising up to that final highest point at about 45 degrees up.
content.summary: One star-like but bigger brighter orange light rising slowly from horizon to about 15 degrees, then disappeared, reappeared with another both rose slowly to about 45 degrees then disappeared

content.detailedDescription: For almost a year exactly i have been seeing glowing light orbs. first one i was lying in bed and saw a very bright "new" planet that i head never seen before pursue my window. i laid there a long time wondering what it was. when i turned to ask my husband to look it vanished. several weeks later i could see it out my other bedroom window and it too vanished when i tried to wake my husband to see it. on and of for months a would see it. then december 2011, a couple weeks before christmas my soon was driving us home in the dark. i was playing solitaire on my phone. he turned onto our street  and said, "omg!"and above a hill that is usually covered with cows were 3 light orbs in a triangle pattern.Before i could switch the camera on my phone one light went left, one went right, and the other went up. this was around 7pm on a thursday night. christmas morning around 5am my ambitious children woke up and upon entering my room to wake me saw the 3 orbs in a triangle again and closer to the house. the orbs left before i awoke.  we have not seen any since and i have kept this quiet until these recent sightings. this was the first time someone beside myself has seem these.
content.summary: Flowing orb sightings in kansas

content.detailedDescription: I had just awakened from sleep, rolled over to get my glasses, and happened to look out my north faceing window in my bedroom whenin the north sky over the mountains in the gila wilderness, there appeared an extremely bright, silvery, white light comeing in from above.  the streak of light was not a straight streak like a meteor but had a wobble to it, like the object was spinning.  it was extremely bright, like a stroke of lightning with with a slight silvery look about it.  it was about the same width as a match head held at arms length.  the total lingth of the path of light was approximately the width of two hands and seemed to slow down a bit the lower it got to the mountains.  at the end of its flight path, it ended in an extremely bright white flash, that lit up most of the  mountain range just west of the turkey creek camp ground which is about 10 to 15 miles away from our trailer.  about 1 minute later there was a brillient flash of light straight overhead and slightly to the north of our position.  where we live, we have a totally unobstructed view of the mountains of the gila wilderness.  turkey creek is well known locally as a ufo hotspot as many lights of unknown origin have been seen in that area for several years.  it is a quiet, remote area and requires a 4-wheel drive vehicle to safely get there.  if more information is required, just let me know, and i will supply to the best of my ability.
content.summary: Possible ufo in distress

content.detailedDescription:
My girlfriend and i were driving around hollywood, ca, and looked up at the sky and saw 3 lights in the sky in the formation of a triangle.
then the two bottom lights moved at the same time and speed apart from each other very slowly.
i continued driving.
content.summary: 3 bright lights in the sky forming a triangle.

content.detailedDescription:
My girlfriend and i were driving around hollywood, ca, and looked up at the sky and saw 3 lights in the sky in the formation of a triangle.
then the two bottom lights moved at the same time and speed apart from each other very slowly.
i continued driving.
content.summary: 3 bright lights in the sky forming a triangle.

content.detailedDescription:
My girlfriend and i were driving around hollywood, ca, and looked up at the sky and saw 3 lights in the sky in the formation of a triangle.
then the two bottom lights moved at the same time and speed apart from each other very slowly.
i continued driving.
content.summary: 3 bright lights in the sky forming a triangle.

content.detailedDescription: We were sitting in the kitchen, just after midnite, my sister, her husband and my husband. my sister glanced out the window and saw something in the sky. she ran out the door telling us to come out. we went out onto the back patio and saw this glowing orange orb coming from the east pretty quickly. we thought maybe it was a new years balloon, but it was moving too quickly. i ran back into the house and grabbed my camcorder, but by the time i got back out it had moved even further north. i still tried to film and zoom in. in the video, the light to the lower right is a cell phone tower. i tried to film the object as best as i could. it was such a brillant orange color! we watched til it faded from our view to the north.
content.summary: It glowed orange and was round to teardrop shaped

content.detailedDescription: Outside of a friend's apartment shouting happy new year . saw it come up from the horizon,and yelled for everyone to come out of the house to look at this thing there were about 7 people outside who watched it go from 1 side of the sky to the other is a very fast speed .We were watching some fireworks and we noticed that the orange fireball was not behaving like a firework ,being it traveled across the sky horizontally.As far as feelings i would say we were all excited and mystified of what it was .After about 30 or 40 seconds of watching it it disappeared over the apartment building at the other side of the courtyard .
content.summary: Glowing orange ball flew overhead ay a high rate of speed.

content.detailedDescription: I was outside my house watching the sky,as i am an avid sky watcher. i viewed a bright orange light ,approximatley 2500 ft above the ground,moving in a straight line accross the sky from the north toward me(south). it appeared to be moving slower than an airplane. then seemed to appear to gain altitiude and become smaller as it got closer to my house. there was no noise.I called my room mates out to view it.They also saw it. it continued to move southward ,decreasing in size and then it disappeared.
content.summary: Large glowing orange colored light,moving north to south

content.detailedDescription:
I had just finished watching the countdown to 2012 on tv and decided to step outside to hear and watch the chaos of the college-inhabited suburbs of bakersfield, ca. out in the distance i noticed a red-orange light coming from the far south east. i turned away thinking it was just an airplane but it soon caught my attention again as the speed was too fast for a plane. it was far too high and did not move vertically like a helecoptor so i gave it my full attention.

when it finally got close to the town the speed slowed and it made a large circle that took about 20 seconds to complete. this happened a few times, then it began to take off the way it came flickering in and out of color as it did. before it could get out of the city limits though, it flickered one last time and did not come back on. the sighting made me take a few steps back in awe. i have never seen anything like it, and am quite controversial to ufo sightings, my mind has changed in the new year.
content.summary: Bright red light speedily closing in on the city, flickering, then dissapearing all together.

content.detailedDescription: I was outside my house watching the sky,as i am an avid sky watcher. i viewed a bright orange light ,approximatley 2500 ft above the ground,moving in a straight line accross the sky from the north toward me(south). it appeared to be moving slower than an airplane. then seemed to appear to gain altitiude and become smaller as it got closer to my house. there was no noise.I called my room mates out to view it.They also saw it. it continued to move southward ,decreasing in size and then it disappeared.
content.summary: Large glowing orange colored light,moving north to south

content.detailedDescription:
I stopped by a family friend's house for new years eve with my girlfriend. we had another party to attend so we left early about 10:25pm est. as we were walking down the driveway toward the car i noticed a red glowing light in the sky. it seemed very unusual because it was floating way to low to be a plane and was also much lower than i see helicopters typically fly in my area. i gave the object the benefit of the doubt thinking it may just be a helicopter coming at us from head on. yet as i continued to watch the object and as it got closer to us is when it became definitive that this object was flying way to low to be a helicopter.  in addition to the low altitude this object was flying at, there were no faa lights on the object and this object made absolutely no noise as it slowly made its way past us. it was just a glowing red orb. 

the object's distance from us was about a block over and about 100 yards or so above the tree tops. the object flew in a north to south direction. 

while watching the object the two of us had an eerie feeling because of how out of ordinary it was.  the object was moving slow enough that i was able to get out my girlfriend's camera and take a video of the object.  unfortunately, the video does not do the sighting justice. what you can notice from the video is the color of the object (bright glowing red) and that there is no sound from this object. what you cannot tell from the video is how slow the object was traveling and how low the object was to the ground. i zoomed in and out in the video so that is why the object appears larger and smaller. we were able to watch the object until it was so far away it went out of sight. the entire time of the sighting the speed of the object never changed and it did not change its flight path.
content.summary: Silent glowing red orb/light moving slowly across the sky

content.detailedDescription: I was outside my house watching the sky,as i am an avid sky watcher. i viewed a bright orange light ,approximatley 2500 ft above the ground,moving in a straight line accross the sky from the north toward me(south). it appeared to be moving slower than an airplane. then seemed to appear to gain altitiude and become smaller as it got closer to my house. there was no noise.I called my room mates out to view it.They also saw it. it continued to move southward ,decreasing in size and then it disappeared.
content.summary: Large glowing orange colored light,moving north to south

content.detailedDescription:
while sitting on porch,  at about 1900 e time, watching the sky and river, west of loudon, tn... i noticed a helo off to my left decending tword a line of hills on the other side of the tennessee river from my house.  it sruck me as strange, that the color was yellow and a lack of running lights.  there was no sound and as it went into a hover above the 2nd hill to the right, it tended to slip back and forth in a foating motion.  beside the yellow glowing color, a small green light appeared on the front of the 30ft. long elipse.  the craft must have been twisting as it floated above the trees of the 2nd hill about a qtr to a half mile from me becuse a green light appeared to go off and on at the front.
     a road accended from left to right at this side of the hills and as i watched ,cars could be seen, running between kingston and loudon on that road. 
     the sky was clear and aircraft could be seen in transit between various cities in e tennessee.
     i was waiting on my wife to return home so i could drive to knoxville.  as i watched, the craft started to decend in the verticle behind the hills.  no spotlight was seen and no running lights observed. 
     i used to in air control and have years of experince observing aircraft and the sky,  i don't think this was a helo.  
     my wife returned and i went to knoville.
content.summary: appeared from direction of lenior city, tn. looked like a helo at about 2,000 feet.  crossed left to directly accross from me on other side of tn river.  decenced into floating hover above 2nd hill then went down behind hill.

content.detailedDescription: At 8:15pm on dec. 31, 2011, my attention was cuaght to a southwestern window where i saw a huge ball of bright bluish-white light slowly arcing toward the earth to the west. it moved far too slowly to be a meteor/shooting star and was muuch too large. i ran to a western-facing window to see where it went but it had vanished.   the moon was half-full and the skies were very clear. i've never seen anything like it. yes, it was new year's eve but i do not drink and this wasn't a flight of imagination.
content.summary: A brilliant blusih-white ball of unwavering light in the southwest,about the size of the full moon, slowly falling in an arc to the west. did not see it land

content.detailedDescription: We were driving back to our party from a store and stopped at a red light. a blinking object caught the corner of my eye so i stretched forward to look and saw this vivid blue and white blinking object. it was boomerang shaped. the whole object switched from all bright neon blue to bright crisp white over and over and was swirling around in the sky doing figure 8 shapes almost. instantly i yelled at my aunt who was driving "what is that ?!" and she saw it and said "oh my god look at the way it's fully changing colors!" it really freaked us out cause we've never seen anything like this before the colors were so crisp and it wasn't a helicopter or anything like that it was a ufo the way it was swaying in the air and completely changing colors, i wish i had a video of it but i was on my phone calling my family back at the party and i yelled "go outside! look south!!" and they all ran out and saw it even the neighbors next door (who were already outside) were all staring at it too! before we got back to the house they said it disappeared and so we only saw it while driving but we all described it the same way. i would love to know if anyone else saw what we saw last night!
content.summary: Boomerang shaped, fully changing colors from neon blue to bright white

content.detailedDescription: We were sitting in my back yard around a fire pit when my stepson noticed 3 very bright objects in the sky.  when i turned to look, the 3 very bright yellow orange objects began to move in sync traveling in a north to south direction. i quickly grabbed my hd camcorder and recorded this amazing event. after the 3 objects moved out of sight i turned off my camcorder. about 3 minutes later, another of the same objects came from the north traveled in the same exact path and vanished. this happened 2 more times which i also caught on camera. my stepson got chills, it was a very exciting thing to witness. being that this was new years eve, i at first thought that they could have been fireworks or flares, but after watching my video these were not fireworks or flares. these objects were obviously in sync with each other. very amazing. we live in the parkville md. area.
content.summary: Observed several yellow/orange starlike objects stationary then move north to south.

content.detailedDescription:
Dec.31, 2011 at a new year's eve celebration in gibsonton, florida-alafia river(east of tampa). there were 8 people total including me. two friends and i were near the river watching fireworks when we saw a bright orange light hovering over north horizon, close to where fireworks had been set off. i was interested because it stationary, figured it was related to fireworks. then, right when i pointed it out to my friends, it began moving toward sse at a steady pace. the orange light faded into a hazy oval/egg shape that was a very dim pinkish violet and almost translucent against clear sky, then disappeard over trees. was maybe a few thousand feet.

i pulled my husband aside and told him about it and decided not to mention it to the others thinking it was a fluke. then five minutes later i spotted two more from same origin and alerted the rest of the party, who all witnessed the lights too. the lights seemed to travel a similar path as the first one, then they veered slightly away from eachother, then faded out of sight.

from then on for about an hour several more appeared, moving about the same speed, some brightening then dimming, but eventually all of them dimmed and disappeared altogether.

we counted 30, but supposed there may have been more during the time we weren't looking for them.  the last four seemed to appear at the same time. one disappeared and the remaining three formed a triangular shape, held the shape and then all disappeared at the same time. we didn't see anymore after that (about 12:45am).

we ruled out all possibilities-they were not flares, too fast for hot air balloons, couldn't have been aircraft because they were completely silent, were definitely not satelites or shooting stars because some changed direction and were traveling too slow.

my husband recorded about 7 minutes on his cell phone. most of it cannot be seen, but a few were captured, however very dim. we considered reporting the incident but felt we would not be taken seriously as it was new year's and lights were going off everywhere.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Approx 30 orange lights over brandon/riverview florida.

content.detailedDescription: I was riding on a golf cart in a retirement community to a new year���s eve party destination.  i noticed while riding about 8 miles an hour what looked like a star.  it was very bright and most of the time orange.  i tried to squint my eyes to get a better view of beyond the brightness to see details but it was too far and too bright to see anything.  i made sure that other people i was with noticed this same object.  about 6 others saw the object and we all agreed that it was no plane as it moved slowly from east to west.  there was a small plane well below it to the north of it and in comparison of the plane and the orb; the orb was extremely brighter than the plane.  it was about 9:05pm when this took place.  what really struck everyone was the about 3 seconds it seem to just fade into the black of the sky and it was just gone.  one of the other people said they saw it speed away fast.  i did not see it speed away.  it just seemed like it dimmed the lights for a stealth mode.  there was no sound from the object.  the sky was very clear.  i did not have a phone on me and unfortunately while it sounds sad a lot of the other folks had phones but no one took a picture or video of it.   it was fairly large and it was quite far away, brightly orange glow and some fluctuations in slight color, and finally it faded into the night sky.  i was just glad that i was not the only one who saw what i saw.  hopefully someone in the same area saw the same thing and took pictures and will post.  this information can be connected to that as proof.
content.summary: Very bright slightly pulsating orb.  color was orange with a bit of yellow and red.

content.detailedDescription: Just after midnight on new years eve i stood on my deck overlooking napa valley watching the lights of the city. from the north came a yellowish red glowing light. i fly and know the what an airplane looks like in the dark. i called my wife out to look as this light began to slowly silently make a turn to the west and back north then stop to hover about two thousand feet high. i had good reference points by the hill tops. there was no other aircraft lights in the sky at that point. something appeared to drip from the craft red in color and stayed lit half way to ground. second drip was less bright. craft a few seconds later lights went out ascraft loosed to fall from sky. about  1000 feet below marking lights of and aircraft appeared going west. lights of this aircraft different then others i have seen being spaced well apart   two outer in red with four whit between them. no noise. this craft was seen by others on dec. 16,2011 over napa
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Redish orange flew slowly suoth down napa valley just above hill tops apx. 1,000 ft. made slow 180 turn to west and stopes to drop two glowing objects light went out carft seemed to fall. aircraft was seen turning away well below

content.detailedDescription: My wife got out of bed at 0230 & looked out the window noticing how bright the stars were when a horizontal oblong green object directly ahead caught her attention. extending the arm with the finger & thumb spaced at 2 in. apart was the apparent length. the opaque green object was hovering stationary not far above the tree line which is 500 ft away. it also had a row of 5 near white lights in a horizontal row in the lower half of the craft that would blink in sequence, 1,2,3,4,5 than all out, 1 2 3 4 5 , all out, etc from left to right.The lights were large enough to see easily but more like marker lights than spot lights. after thinking this was highly unusual she returned to bed without noticing any change in  movement or appearance.
content.summary: Object sighted from 2nd floor window looking west,had a row of blinking lights on lower edge ,watched for 15 min in clear sky

content.detailedDescription: On dec 31 at approximately 2000 hours myself (ex law enforcement, officer military and current firefighter) and two other witnesses  were sitting on the 8th floor balcony facing southeast of the hampton inn in cocoa beach. we were watching people shooting of fire works and having fun before the new year. approximately 4 miles away in a south direction in the area of patrick airforce base we observed a bright red/yellow light that appeared to look like a rocket shoot up from the area of the ocean front (atlantic). the object at first went up at a 45 degree angle heading west. at first we thought it might be a flair but we noticed the object getting higher in altitude and gaining speed. living in the cocoa beach area and near nasa we have seen all typs of rockets and shuttles lunch. the object we observed made no sound,no military escort witch they normally do have when lunched from nasa. the object continued to gain altitude and head west until it was out of sight. the object hade all indications of a rocket launch but the nasa launch site is 20 miles east of where we observed the object. i contacted patrick air base and they stated they do not launch from there site nore do they launch from the water. we did not have our cameras with us to take a video. from my experience from being in the military and a dod contract firefighter, i have observed missile and rocket launches of all typs. what we observed was something i have never seen in my life. there has been no chatter about the object online or in the news as of today jan 1st 2012. this is my first ufo encounter i have observed.
content.summary: Rocket typ object from ocean heading west over land.

content.detailedDescription: I was closing curtains in my bedroom to go to bed and noticed a slowly moving red light in the sky. it was a steady red light with nothing flashing from it and moving so slowly that i ruled out an air plane. it was much too high in the sky to be fireworks from festivities. i thought meteor but do meteors move so slowly??? anyhow, my wife also witnessed it and we watched for about 3 minutes and it dissappeared either under the thick cloud cover or just vanished.
content.summary: Red light moving slowly at 12:15 jan 1 2012

content.detailedDescription: On new years eve 2011, i was on vacation with family in a condo park. we were traveling on a golf cart at exactly 9pm when i looked up at the sky. i always look at the stars at night, especially here in florida where they are more visible compared to back home where i live. i pointed out (4 other people) a reddish orange ball of light in the sky. it seemed to be hovering in the sky to the right of orion's belt in the western sky. i then located jupiter, mars, sirius and betelgeuse, the brightest objects i could think of. this object was none of them. i never took my eyes off of the object. i wanted to know what this thing was. we were traveling north at approx. 10 miles per hour. the object seemed to be moving very slowly to the south. no noise, no aircraft lights. the object looked twice as big as jupiter does in the sky. i work at an airport and can say for sure that this was not a commercial airplane. it seemed to move very slowly to the south for approx. 20-30 seconds and then dimmed out to nothing, just vanished. there was sea fog in the area at the time, so i dont know if the object vanished into thin air or thick fog. i was very excited to have seen this object. we arrived to our destination about 10 seconds after the object disappeared. we were talking about it and found that another group of people (3) had seen it as well from their golf cart. i have never before seen anything out of the ordinary in the skies. i feel that the object may have been a ufo, since i have found no other explanation. i periodically scanned the night skies until 1am, but never saw the object again. i hope others have seen the same thing to help verify my sighting.
content.summary: Red-orange starlike orb in florida sky new years eve 2011

content.detailedDescription:
1st time there where 2 crafts this was on the 23rd of dec 2011 at about 9:45
this was on gatlin blvd in port st lucie i was riding with a friend who seen the craft also. it was following a public airline plane and then another came down from space joined the other craft and then they both left very very fast and smooth with no noise at all. then i seen them again on jan 1st 2012 this time i was in the back yard by a bonfire and my wife saw it first and also the same friend that saw the first set with me was there also this time it was about 1:15am
we where watching them hover over our house for about 15 min and then began to travel north west into the atmosphere kinda wobbly and then solid and then took off real smooth until we could not see it and then about 20 mins later it came back and followed a similar path but then cut to the right and stayed in sight for about 10 min and then took off really really really fast and all this with no sound and the weirdest reddish orange glow.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: 2 crafts

content.detailedDescription: At 12 midnight in my back yard i looked up and saw 6 orange balls in the sky i thought they were planes but was wrong no sound 4 went south 2 stayed over my house for about 3 to 4 min than went south 2 slow and 1 fast then they were just gone and i see by the map on this site that the same thing was seen all ove the country.
content.summary: 6 orange balls looked like fire balls
